alert.note: Alert for Marion (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 25 at 12:50PM EDT until March 26 at 3:03AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Sugar Creek at New Palestine. Big Blue River at Carthage and Shelbyville. Flatrock River near Columbus. Driftwood River near Edinburgh. Youngs Creek at Amity. Mill Creek near Cataract. Buck Creek at Acton. Sugar Creek near Edinburgh. Muscatatuck River at Vernon. Mississinewa River near Ridgeville. Eel River at Bowling Green. .Widespread rainfall of 2 to nearly 5 inches has resulted in widespread lowland flooding along the Wabash, White, and East Fork White Rivers, along with numerous smaller tributaries. These smaller tributaries will drop back below flood within the next few days. Water continues to rise in many locations on main stem rivers, however, and crests in some areas, particularly along lower reaches of the White and Wabash, will not arrive for several days. Moderate flooding is expected in a small number of locations. Flooding will likely last for a week or more in some areas. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Buck Creek at Acton. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, Flooding in progress along Buck Creek in southeast Marion and northwest Shelby Counties. Flooding primarily affects agricultural land and some recreational areas. Flooding of Shelby CR 700N one quarter of a mile east of Shelby CR 875W may begin at this level especially if Sugar Creek at New Palestine is 7 feet or higher. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 10.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:00 PM EDT Saturday was 10.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.2 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated by 11 PM EDT this evening.
